content.description:
Infelix Dido, verus mihi1 nuntius ergo 
venerat exstinctam ferroque extrema secutam? 
Funerisfunus, -eris, n. = mors, -tis heuheu, interj.: alas! tibi causa fui? Per sidera iuroiuro, -are: to swear,
per superos et si qua fides tellure sub imaimus, -a, -um, adj.: lowest est, 

Line 5invitus, regina, tuo de litore cessi.
Sed me iussa deumdeum = deorum, quae nunc has ire per umbras, 
per loca sentasentus, -a, -um, adj.: rough situsitus, -us, m.: decay cogunt noctemque profundamprofundus, -a, -um, adj. = altus, -a, -um, 
imperiis egereegere = egerunt suis.

Aeneid 6.456-463
 1:refers to Aeneas↩
content.question:
Answer the following question(s) in English unless the question specifically asks you to provide Latin words.
What are the case and number of iussa (line 6)?

unit.text: 5: Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 4, 6, 7, 11, and 12

skill.text: 1.B: Describe how grammar contributes to the meaning and function of Latin words and phrases in context.
